variant.question: The flight crew has reported a rusty landing gear in the aircraft tech-log. After a maintenance check, the aircraft remained in service. What kind of maintenance check did the aircraft undergo?
A torsion link assembly is installed on the landing gear to

options.text: avoid rotation of the piston rod relative to the fixed part of the oleo strut.
provide damping of the vertical motion during touch-down.

variant.question:
The systems used for emergency extension of landing systems may comprise of
 
1) compressed CO2.
 
2) compressed nitrogen.
 
3) compressed oxygen.
 
4) auxiliary hydraulic system.
 
5) free-fall (gravity).
 The combination regrouping all the correct statements is
To prevent the landing gear from collapsing when the aircraft is parked on the ground, following device is used
Generally, on modern jet transport aeroplanes, if there is a complete hydraulic system failure, the landing gear can be extended by
In a commercial transport aeroplane the landing gear normal operating system is usually
The pilot may be prevented from retracting the landing gear whilst the aircraft is on the ground:

options.text: by the electrical control system being disabled by the weight on wheels switch.
by a pneumatic interlock which disables the hydraulic up selector.
because any attempt to select the landing gear up will result in a flashing warning light and a loud horn.
by a guard on the selector switch which cannot be moved until the aircraft is airborne.

variant.question: The emergency method of lowering the landing gear on a modern jet transport aeroplane is by

options.text: suction created by the dynamic airflow.

variant.question: The damping element in a landing gear shock absorber used on large aircraft is...
When an emergency nitrogen bottle is used for the landing gear:

options.text: it lowers the landing gear and the doors remain open.
it lowers the landing gear and subsequently closes the doors.
it lowers and retracts the landing gear, depending on the setting in the cockpit.
it retracts the landing gear only.

variant.question: On landing gear, most stress is carried by a torsion link...

options.text: between the inner and outer cylinder of the main oleo leg during a small radius turn.
on the outer cylinder of the main oleo leg during a small radius turn
on the inner cylinder of the main oleo leg during a small radius turn.
on the inner cylinder of the main oleo leg during a large radius turn.

variant.question: In transport aircraft equipped with retractable landing gear, there must be a clear indication to the pilot

options.text: whenever the landing gear position is not consistent with landing gear selector lever position.
whenever the gear is erroneously selected to retract on the ground.
when gear selection is performed above the gear limit speed.
whenever the landing gear selector is not in the neutral position.

variant.question: If the back-up system of extending the landing gear is of the free-fall type, what is moved with mechanical power first?
For aircraft equipped with a landing gear anti-retract latch, which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: This system can be overridden under specific conditions.
This system prevents the gear retraction when the IAS is too high.
This system prevents the gear retraction when the IAS is too low.
This system can not be overridden since an uncentred nose wheel can damage the wheel well structure.

variant.question: V~LO~ is the maximum:

options.text: speed at which the landing gear can be operated with full safety.
speed with flaps extended in a given position.
cruising speed not to be exceeded except in still air with caution.
flight speed with landing gear down.

variant.question: V~LE~ is the maximum:

options.text: flight speed with landing gear down.
speed at which the landing gear can be operated with full safety.
speed with flaps extended in a given position.

An anti-retract latch blocks the landing gear lever when:

options.text: the aircraft is on the ground.
the IAS is too high for gear retraction.
the IAS is too low for gear retraction.
the gear is in unsuitable configuration for extension.

variant.question: Overcentre mechanisms in landing gear systems are used to:

options.text: lock the landing gear in the down position.
lock the landing gear in the up position.
ensure the nose wheel is centred prior to retraction.
ensure that the nose wheel does not exceed the maximum deflection.

An aural alert is generated by a landing gear extension system when:

options.text: attempting to perform a landing with the gear retracted.
flying too fast with the gear extended.
attempting to retract gear while on the ground (weight on wheels).

variant.question: When using the pressurized nitrogen bottle system for emergency landing gear extension:

options.text: The emergency system is activated manually by pulling a handle in the cockpit, allowing a one-shot extension.
The emergency system is activated manually by pulling a handle in the cockpit, allowing the system to be used several times.
The emergency system is automatically activated upon failure of the main system, allowing a one-shot extension of the landing gear.
The emergency system is automatically activated upon failure of the main system and can be used several times.

variant.question: Over center mechanisms in landing gear systems are generally used to

options.text: Lock the landing gear in place
Defalates the tyres automatically if the temperature rises too high
Keep the landing gear doors closed

variant.question: A red or an amber light on an undercarriage position indicator signifies:

options.text:
At least one wheel is in the travelling or unlocked
condition.

The landing gear has been selected down using the
emergency extension system.
All wheels are down and locked.
All wheels are up and locked.

 Which part of the main landing gear is shown by the number 2?
Which of the following statements is true about an emergency gear extension system?

options.text: In the gravity free fall system doors remain open.
In the gravity free fall system doors shut electrically.
In the gravity free fall system doors shut pneumatically.
In the gravity free fall system doors shut manually.

variant.question: How does the emergency landing gear extension usually occur in a modern jet transport aircraft?

options.text: Gravity extension with doors remaining open.
Gravity extension with doors closed by a separate hydraulic actuator.
Gravity extension with doors closed by a separate electrical actuation.
Emergency electronic method of lowering the gear with the doors remaining open.

variant.question: A main landing gear is said to be "locked down" when:

options.text: the strut is locked by an overcentre mechanism.
the actuating cylinder is at the end of its travel.
the corresponding indicator lamp is amber.
it is in the down position.

variant.question: Ground spoilers are activated:

options.text: When the weight on wheels switch is activated.
Only if reverse thrust is selected.
If spin-up of all wheels has been detected.

variant.question: The automatic ground spoiler extension system is normally activated during landing by:
The primary element necessary for automatic ground spoiler deployment during landing is...

options.text: operating the ground spoiler control handle.

variant.question: During a normal pressurized climb after take-off:

options.text: cabin pressure decreases more slowly than atmospheric pressure.
absolute cabin pressure increases to compensate for the fall in pressure outside the aeroplane.
the pressurization system is inoperative until an altitude of 10 000 ft is reached.
the cabin differential pressure is maintained constant.

variant.question: The shear neck is a device fitted to prevent...

options.text: Engine failure, in case of mechanical failure of the gearbox.
Oil leaks, in case of mechanical failure of the gearbox.
Engine fire, in case of mechanical failure of the gearbox.
Engine failure, in case of excessive speed of the gearbox.
